name: Use version instead of timestamp
description: Reports all hibernate entities that use timestamp property instead of version.
output:
The metric will list all hibernate entities that use timestamp property instead of version.

It provides the following information:
 Hibernate Entity
rationale:
In theory, a timestamp is slightly less safe, since two concurrent transactions might both load and update the same item all in the same millisecond; in practice, this is unlikely to occur. However, we recommend that new projects use a numeric version and not a timestamp.
For example, you might encounter this issue: after daylight savings took effect, every call to update an entry into my database created before daylight savings took effect would result in a StaleObject-StateException.
If your timestamp data type doesn't include a daylight saving time attribute, you'll run into problems with Hibernate's automatic versioning. A version property is less problematic for automatic versioning; hence we recommend it.
total: The total is the number of hibernate entity that use version or timestamp property.
